name: Executive Inn Express Richmond

reviews.title: Not a great choice
reviews.text: The only reason I stayed here is because there was a cheap rate online. Rooms are basic. Hotel is passable. NO AMMENITIES other than a small restaurant on-site. Some rooms have a kitchenette with sink, microwave and bar fridge.

reviews.title: Horrible!!!!!!!!!
reviews.text: - Remote control for TV would not work. Hotel staff would not come to my room to replace the remote. They said they would, 24 hours later, they still hadn't. I ACTUALLY HAD TO CARRY THE TV TO THE LOBBY TO GET THEM TO PAY ATTENTION TO ME. And even then, they didn't care that I carried it down (it's only a 19" Samsung... not heavy).

reviews.title: No problems here! Very happy!
reviews.text: - Website lists this place as having "wireless internet in public areas". THIS IS A LIE. THEY HAVE NO WIRELESS ANYWHERE. Phone if you don't believe me. I would've stayed elsewhere if I had known to phone first to confirm details that this website should provide accuracy over.

reviews.title: Don't Be Fooled
reviews.text: - Fitness centre.... what a joke.... it is a dank old conference room with some home-gym Walmart quality weights, etc.

reviews.title: Avoid this hotel, if possible.
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night in August 2006. Hotel is close to the Vancouver airport but is in major need of an overhaul. The lobby smells badly and has scruffy furniture, the rooms are dirty and old, and the entrance to the lobby consists of your choice of a large number of stairs or a badly-designed rampway (difficult to manouever a luggage cart in). Paid $89 CDN for our room--would recommend looking around for another hotel in the area. The elevator is very dirty, and it seems the hotel has not been cleaned in a long time.

I actually found my experience at this hotel to be comfortable and well worth what I paid for my stay of 5 nights. When I checked in, the staff were friendly and were more than willing to answer all my questions about Vancouver tours and local malls. They also recommended a car rental agency for me and called them on my behalf. They arranged for the car rental to come and pick me up too! The room was spacious and I was told that I had a newly remodelled room and it looked new to me. Everything was clean and bright. I also visited their restaurant for dinner and was amazed by the presentation and quality of the steak and it was very reasonable as well. Breakfasts were also very tasty with nice fluffy omelettes. I would recommend this place to my friends as I found my experience positive and well worth what I paid. I had checked around for rates and this was the most reasonable price.
reviews.title: Comfortable rooms, Excellent Restaurant & Friendly Staff
Awful! Gave up my prepaid room to avoid staying there again!
reviews.text: The hotel may look okay from the outside for $70 a night but it was definitely not worth it inside. I needed an express hotel that had the airport shuttle and I should have stayed down the road at one of the other 3 hotels that were about the same price. The elevator smelled like kitty litter. The first room they gave us had a really strong odor of paint. They changed rooms for us and the first thing you see is a bed that is barely above the floor and sagging in the middle of the mattress. THe light fixture was coming off the wall, there were big cracks up the side of the wall and your room's front door felt like it used to be a motel door (outside) that had recent glass put up to make it feel inside. It looks like it had been an average hotel (like a Holiday Inn)in its prime but now looks like something from the bad side of town.

reviews.title: Absolutely horrible, mean staff, disgusting rooms, not clean at all
reviews.text: We had pre-paid two nights, one on each end of our trip to Mexico. When we came back our flight was a little early and we actually picked up our car with our 4 year old daughter and hurried to catch the last ferry to Vancouver Island at 10:45pm even though it meant driving until 2am to get home to Victoria just to sleep in our own beds and not experience that awful hotel again.

reviews.title: OK for the Price (Cdn$62)
reviews.text: My mom, grandmother, aunt and myself decided to do a girls weekend trip to Vancouver and unfortunately booked at this hotel. The rates seemed comparable to other hotels in the area, but the quailty of this hotel was so poor.

reviews.title: Never again!
reviews.text: Spent the night due to an early departure. Room dingy, sheets smelled musty, room smelled of tobacco (requested non-smoking). Returned 2 weeks later to find that someone broke into our truck while it was parked underneath the building. The management, fortunately, removed a few personal items left in the cab and kept them for us. Unfortunately, they didn't notice that our car also suffered body damage (possibly a separate incident). The management simply shrugged and said they weren't responsible, and they had no insurance to protect us.

reviews.title: I had a horrible time..........
reviews.text: Unfortunately, my vehicle was stolen in their open car park overnight.

reviews.title: Nice folks here
reviews.text: The carpark is quite dark, not properly lighted and hence a very decent spot for thieves to break in. And security there was very loose.

aka: Executive Inn Express Richmond Hotel Vancouver
